title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A classic novel exploring themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

author: George Orwell
summary: A cautionary tale about totalitarianism, thought control, and surveillance in a dystopian future.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A witty and charming novel about the complexities of love, marriage, and societal norms.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A story of wealth, excess, and the American Dream set in the Roaring Twenties.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: The first book in the magical series following a young wizard's adventures at Hogwarts School.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: A coming-of-age novel that captures the alienation and disillusionment of a teenage boy.

title: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
summary: A stream-of-consciousness novel that explores the inner thoughts and experiences of its characters.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: A dystopian vision of a future society controlled by technology, consumerism, and social engineering.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: An epic tale of obsession and revenge as Captain Ahab pursues the elusive white whale, Moby-Dick.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic fantasy trilogy following the journey to destroy a powerful ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
summary: A Gothic romance novel depicting the struggles and triumphs of a governess, Jane Eyre.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: A charming adventure about Bilbo Baggins, who joins a group of dwarves on a quest to reclaim a lost kingdom.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
summary: A multi-generational tale blending magical elements with the history of the Buendía family.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: A psychological novel that delves into the mind of a young man who commits a murder and grapples with guilt.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A Gothic tale of a man who remains young and handsome while his portrait ages, capturing the corruption of his soul.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
summary: A dark and passionate tale of love and revenge between the residents of Wuthering Heights and Thrushcross Grange.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: A sweeping novel depicting the tragic consequences of Anna Karenina's adulterous affair in 19th-century Russia.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
summary: A classic tale of science and morality, as Dr. Frankenstein creates a living creature and faces the consequences.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
summary: A dystopian novel where a young boy learns about the dark truths behind his seemingly perfect society.
